result.execSummary:
The defendant Gail E. Haley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs.     Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gail E. Haley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:45 a.m. Defendant Gail E. Haley in court with attorney Adam Raabe. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Defendant participated in the pretrial supervision program.
14CF90 Ct 1: OWI 4th (.177% reading):  W/H Sentence, 2 yr Probation: Conditions: 150 days conditional Jail, $1,200 fine + costs = $2,452.00, $26.45 blood draw, 35 mo revocation of driver's license, 35 mo IID, AODA/DOT Safety plan. Cts: 2 & 3 to be DRI.
14CF109: W/H Sentence: 4 yrs Probation, concurrent with 14CF90.
14CF202 Ct 2:  W/H Sentence: 2 yrs Probation, concurrent.  Ct 1 to be DRI.

(14CF288: Preliminary & Arraignment held today:
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

 State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.)

Prosecuter states plea agreement for 14CF288: Ct 1: Probation. Ct 2 & 3 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreements as stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF90 Ct 1: OWI 4th: No Contest
14CF109 Possess Narcotic: No Contest
14CF202 ct 2: Possess THC: No Contest
14CF288 Ct 1: Bail Jumping: 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  
14CF90 Ct 1: OWI 4th, 14CF109 Possess Narcotic, 14CF202 ct 2, 14CF288 Ct 1: Bail Jumping. Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 
--
14CF90 cts 2 & 3 are dismissed read in.
14CF202 ct 1 is dismissed read in.
14CF288 Ct 2 & 3 are dismissed read in.

***************PROBATION***********
14CF90 Ct 1: OWI 4th: W/H Sentence: 2 yr Probation.
150 days conditional Jail, Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.  Sentence to commence within 60 days. Must report today for start date.  May serve 1/2 of jail sentence in jail and balance on electronic monitor according to jail rules.
$1,200 fine + costs = $2,452.00 
$26.45 blood draw
35 mo revocation of driver's license, Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation
35 mo IID 
AODA/DOT Safety plan.

14CF109 Possess Narcotic: W/H Sentence: 4 yr Probation: 
Conditions: 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.  
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
Pay court costs including DNA surcharge.

14CF202 ct 2 Possess THC: W/H SEntence 12 mo Probation, concurrent with 14CF90 and 14CF109, Comply with same conditions as stated in 14CF109. Pay costs.
14CF288 Ct 1: Bail Jumping , W/H Sentence: 4 yr Probation: concurrent with 14CF109, Comply with same conditions as stated in 14CF109. Pay costs.
Plea hearing on October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on April 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Case 14CF90: Court calls case at 3:35 p.m. Defendant Gail E. Haley in court with attorney Adam Raabe. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Cousins calls witness, Officer Wachowick, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.  Witness identifies the Defendant in Court.  Exhibit P#1 Copy of Toxicology Report  is marked and referred to during direct exam.
3:41 p.m. Cross exam by Atty Raabe.
3:44 p.m. Redirect.  Exhibit P#1 is moved and received.
  Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.


Case #14CF109 was set for an initial appearance.  Bailiff retrieved filed.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties. Waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information for both files.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued in 14CF90 will also cover 14CF109 and a copy of will be placed in the file.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.
